name: GitLab
description:
GitLab is a web-based Git-repository manager providing wiki, issue-tracking and CI/CD pipeline features, using an open-source license, developed by GitLab Inc.
Initially as a source code management solution to collaborate with his team on software development. It later evolved to an integrated solution covering the software development life cycle, and then to the whole DevOps life cycle.
It follows an open-core development model where the core functionality is released under an open source (MIT) license while the additional functionality is under a proprietary license.
#### License:
* Community Edition: MIT License
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default 2vCPU, 4 GB RAM.
#### Resources Installed:
* Gitlab
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810
* Select the [AMI](https://goo.gl/td2eJJ) according to the region on AWS.
* Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/51oD7D) according to the zone on GCP.
* Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/KZAjE6) according to the location on Azure.
#### Platform:
* AHV
* AWS
* GCP
* Azure
* VMware
#### Lifecycle:
* NA
#### Limitations:
* Single VM GitLab Instance. HA not available.
* Not recommended for the production use. 
#### Other Instructions:
* Open port 80 and 443 under Firewall/Security group.
author: Nutanix
